metadata.Title: CVE-2019-7665 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In elfutils 0.175, a heap-based buffer over-read was discovered in the function elf32_xlatetom in elf32_xlatetom.c in libelf. A crafted ELF input can cause a segmentation fault leading to denial of service (program crash) because ebl_core_note does not reject malformed core file notes.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7665` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

elfutils - 0.170-0.4ubuntu0.1
libasm1 - 0.170-0.4ubuntu0.1
libdw1 - 0.170-0.4ubuntu0.1
libelf1 - 0.170-0.4ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: elfutils package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.170-0.4ubuntu0.1').
